intro: Acourtia palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's acourtia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils in desert regions. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in the spring, and it has narrow, grass-like leaves. Acourtia palmeri is adapted to drought conditions and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
